description.narrative: (Ghana): To increase ownership and improve behaviors, USAID will use fiscal year 2018 funds to strengthen the capacity of the Ghana Health Service's Health Promotion Department (GHS/HPD) to effectively and efficiently design and execute evidence-based social and behavior change communication (SBCC). USAID will partner with GHS/HPD to conduct health promotion activities that foster healthy behaviors and increase demand and use of key health services, including family planning; newborn and child health; nutrition; water, sanitation, and hygiene; and malaria prevention and treatment. USAID will support the migration of the "GoodLife" social media platform to the GHS IT platform, to inform target audiences on key health messages and create interactive discussion fora between patients and service providers to clarify health issues. USAID will support the GHS/HPD to establish an online digital library of SBCC materials and tools that will be accessible to the academic community and program implementers. To foster self-reliance and sustainability of USAID investments in SBCC, assistance will establish a resource mobilization committee to address funding gaps for GHS SBCC and health promotion. .
